content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function with derivative given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, the square root of x cubed, plus 1, end root" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></math>. What is the length of the graph of <math alttext="y equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> from <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math> to <math alttext="x equals 1.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 8.13: (BC ONLY) The Arc Length of a Smooth, Planar Curve and Distance Traveled
